list.content: A loaf pan is made in the shape of a cylinder. The pan has a diameter of $24\,\mathrm{cm}$ and a height of $5\,\mathrm{cm}$. ![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/2c59aaf1-7a6c-449c-8cf3-e591daef9363/images/0fbe4f18-84db-44cb-b0f8-9423cd562bc4/a347288bee589088e6dce052611dad40b73c72e7.svg) - Calculate the volume of this pan. [2] Gloria prepares enough bread dough to exactly fill the pan. The dough was in the shape of a sphere. - Find the radius of the sphere in cm, correct to one decimal place. [3] The bread was cooked in a hot oven. Once taken out of the oven, the bread was left in the kitchen. The temperature, $T$, of the bread, in degrees Celsius, $\text{\textdegree{C}}$, can be modelled by the function $$ T(t) = a\times(1.51)^{-\frac{t}{3}} + 21, \hspace{0.5em} t \geq 0, $$ where $a$ is a constant and $t$ is the time, in minutes, since the bread was taken out of the oven. When the bread was taken out of the oven its temperature was $205$ $\text{\textdegree{C}}$. - Find the value of $a$. [2] - Find the temperature that the bread will be $10$ minutes after it is taken out of the oven. [2] The bread can be eaten once its temperature drops to $35$ $\text{\textdegree{C}}$. - Calculate, to the nearest minute, the time since the bread was taken out of the oven until it can be eaten. [3] - In the context of this model, state what the value of $21$ represents. [1]
list.markScheme:
- Using the volume of a cylinder formula with $r = 12$ and $h = 5$, we
get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{2.05em} V_{\text{pan}} &= \pi r^2h \\[6pt]
  &= \pi(12)^2(5) \\[6pt]
  &= 720\pi \qref{(1)}  \\[6pt]
  &=2261.9...\\[6pt]
  &\answer{\approx 2260 \text{ cm}^3}\end{aligned}
  $$

- Using the volume of a sphere formula, we have

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{5.4em} V_{\text{dough}} &= V_{\text{pan}} \\[6pt]
  \dfrac{4}{3}\pi r^3 &= 720\pi \hspace{3em} [\text{from  $(1)$}] \qref{(2)}\end{aligned}
  $$

  Hence, solving the equation $(2)$ for $r$, we obtain

  $$
  \hspace{12.9em} \answer{r \approx 8.1 \text{ cm}} \hspace{3em} [\text{by using G.D.C.}]
  $$

- Solving the equation $T(0) = 205$ for $a$, we find

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  a\times(1.51)^0 + 21 &= 205 \hspace{5.65em} \\[6pt]
  a + 21 &= 205 \\
  \end{aligned}
  $$


  $$
  \hspace{0.8em} \answer{a = 184}
  $$

- Evaluating $T(t)$ for $t=10$, we get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{4em} T(10) &= 184\times(1.51)^{-\frac{10}{3}} + 21 \\[9pt]
  &\answer{\approx 67.6 \text{\hspace{0.15em}\textdegree{C}}}\end{aligned}
  $$

- Solving the equation $T(t) = 35$ for $t$, we obtain

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{1.6em} 184\times(1.51)^{-\frac{t}{3}} + 21 &= 35 \\[6pt]
  t &\approx 18.8 \hspace{3.5em} [\text{by using G.D.C.}] \\
  \end{aligned}
  $$


  $$
  \hspace{1.8em} \answer{t \approx 19 \text{ minutes}}
  $$

- $\answer{\text{\(21\) is the room  temperature of the kitchen in degrees celsius.}}$

list.content: A population of goldfish decreases exponentially. The size of the population, $P$, after $t$ days is modelled by the function $$ \begin{aligned} P(t) = 8000\times2^{-t} + 100, \hspace{0.5em} t \geq 0. \\ \end{aligned} $$ - Write down the exact size of the initial population. [1] - Find the size of the population after $5$ days. [2] - Calculate the time it will take for the size of the population to decrease to $120$.[2] The population will stabilize when it reaches a size of $n$. - Write down the value of $n$. [1]
list.markScheme:
- Evaluating $P(t)$ for $t = 0$, we get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{4.7em} P(0) &= 8000\times2^0 + 100 \\[6pt]
  &= 8000 + 100 \\[6pt]
  &\answer{= 8100}\end{aligned}
  $$

- Evaluating $P(t)$ for $t = 5$, we obtain

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{5.3em} P(5) &= 8000\times2^{-5} + 100 \\[6pt]
  &\answer{= 350}\end{aligned}
  $$

- Solving the equation $P(t) = 120$ for $t$, we find

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  8000\times2^{-t} + 100 &= 120 \hspace{6.1em} \\
  \end{aligned}
  $$


  $$
  \hspace{14.2em} \answer{t = 8.64 \text{ days}} \hspace{3em} [\text{by using G.D.C.}]
  $$

- We have

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{11.9em} \lim_{t\rightarrow\infty} P(t) &= \lim_{t\rightarrow\infty} \big[8000\times2^{-t} + 100\big] \\[6pt]
  &= 0+100 \hspace{2em} [\text{since $2^{-t} \rightarrow 0$ as $t \rightarrow \infty$}] \\[10pt]
  &= 100 \text{ fish}\end{aligned}
  $$

  Hence the value of $n$ is
$\answer{100}$

list.title: Question 9
list.content: - Write the expression $4\ln 2 - \ln 8$ in the form of $\ln k$, where $k \in \mathbb{Z}$. [3] - Hence, or otherwise, solve $4\ln 2 - \ln 8 = -\ln (2x)$. [3]
list.markScheme:
- Using the properties of logarithms, we have

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  4\ln 2 - \ln 8 &= \ln \big(2^4\big) - \ln 8 \\[12pt]
  &= \ln 16 - \ln 8 \\[6pt] 
  &= \ln\Big(\dfrac{16}{8}\Big) \\[9pt]
  & \answer{= \ln 2}\end{aligned}
  $$

- Replacing the left hand side of the equation with $\ln 2$, we get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  4\ln 2 - \ln 8 &= -\ln (2x) \\[12pt]
  \ln 2  &= -\ln(2x) \hspace{2.2em} \\[12pt]
  -\ln 2 &= \ln(2x) \\[12pt]
  \ln \big(2^{-1}\big) &= \ln(2x) \\[12pt]
  2x &= 2^{-1} \\[12pt]
  2x &= \dfrac 1 2 \\[13pt]
  &\hspace{-0.525em} \answer{x = \dfrac{1}{4}}\end{aligned}
  $$

$$

\hspace{0.55em}\answer{x = 300}

list.title: Question 12
list.content: Let $f(x) = e^x - 2$ and $g(x) = 3x + k$, for $x \in \mathbb{R}$, where $k$ is a constant. - Find $(g\circ f)(x)$. [2] - Given that $\displaystyle \lim_{x \rightarrow -\infty} (g\circ f)(x) = -4$, find the value of $k$. [3]
list.markScheme:
- We have

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{1.8em} (g\circ f)(x) &= g(f(x)) \\[6pt]
  &= g(e^x - 2) \\[6pt]
  &= 3(e^x - 2) + k \\[6pt]
  &\answer{= 3e^x - 6 + k}\end{aligned}
  $$

- We have

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \lim_{x \rightarrow -\infty} (g\circ f)(x) &= -4 \hspace{6.9em} \\[4pt]
  \lim_{x \rightarrow -\infty}\hspace{-0.2em}\big[3e^x - 6 + k\big] &= -4 \\[4pt]
  3(0) - 6 + k &= -4 \\[9pt]
  - 6 + k &= -4 \\
  \end{aligned}
  $$


  $$
  \hspace{0.2em} \answer{k = 2}
  $$

Solve the equation $15^{4a} = 81^{a+2}$ for $a$. Express your answer in
terms of $\ln 3$ and $\ln 5$.
list.markScheme:
Using the properties of exponents and logarithms, we get

$$
\begin{aligned}
15^{4a} &= 81^{a+2} \\[10pt]
(3\cdot5)^{4a} &= 3^{4(a+2)} \\[9pt]
\cancel{3^{4a}}\hspace{-0.15em}\cdot5^{4a} &= \cancel{3^{4a}}\hspace{-0.15em}\cdot3^8 \\[10pt]
5^{4a} &= 3^8 \\[10pt]
\ln 5^{4a} &= \ln 3^8 \\[10pt]
4a \ln 5 &= 8\ln 3\end{aligned}
$$


$$
\hspace{2.25em}\answer{a = \dfrac{2\ln 3}{\ln 5}}
$$

list.content: - Show that $3\log_{a^3}x = \log_a x$ where $a$, $x\in \mathbb{R}^+$. [2] It is given that $\log_2 y + \log_8 4x^2 + \log_8 2x = 0$. - Express $y$ in terms of $x$. Give your answer in the form $y=bx^c$ where $b$, $c$ are constants.[6] The region $R$, is bounded by the graph of the function found in part (b), the $x$-axis, and the lines $x=1$ and $x=k$ where $k>1$. The area of $R$ is $\dfrac{3}{2}$. - Find the value of $k$.[4]
list.markScheme:
- Using the properties of logarithms, we get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  3\log_{a^3}x &= 3 \, \dfrac{\log_a x}{\log_a a^3} \\[10pt]
  &= \cancel{3} \,\dfrac{\log_a x}{\cancel{3}} \\[10pt]
  &\answer{=\log_a x}\end{aligned}
  $$

- Using the properties of logarithms and part (a), we get

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \log_2 y + \log_8 4x^2 + \log_8 2x  &= 0  \\[8pt]
  \log_2 y + \log_8 8x^3 &= 0 \\[8pt]
  \log_2 y + 3 \log_8 2x &= 0 \\[8pt]
  \log_2 y +  \log_2 2x &= 0  \\[8pt]
  \log_2 y &= -\log_2 2x   \\[8pt]
  \log_2 y &= \log_2 (2x)^{-1}   \\[8pt]
  &\hspace{-0.5em}\answer{y = \dfrac{1}{2}x^{-1}} \end{aligned}
  $$

- First we find the area of $R$ using integration, we have

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \text{Area of }R &= \int_1^k \dfrac{1}{2} \hspace{0.05em}x^{-1} \, \mathrm{d} x \\[8pt]
  &= \left[ \dfrac{1}{2}\ln x \right]_1^k \\[8pt]
  &= \dfrac{1}{2}\ln k \\[8pt]
  \dfrac{3}{2}&= \dfrac{1}{2}\ln k \\[8pt]
  \ln k &= 3 \\[8pt]
  & \hspace{-0.5em}\answer{ k = e^3 } \\
  \end{aligned}
  $$
